Docs.param: Describes the parameters of the feature selection process for each column pair.

member.name: CountFeatureSelection
member.summary: Selects the slots for which the count of non-default values is greater than or equal to a threshold.

remarks.para: This transform uses a set of aggregators to count the number of non-default values for each slot and instantiates a to actually drop the slots. This transform is useful when applied together with a . The count feature selection can remove those features generated by the hash transform that have no data in the examples.

Name of column to transform. If set to , the value of the will be used as source.
If the count of non-default values for a slot is greater than or equal to this threshold in the training data, the slot is preserved.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.ML.Transforms.FeatureSelection.MutualInformationFeatureSelectingEstimator SelectFeaturesBasedOnMutualInformation (this Microsoft.ML.TransformsCatalog.FeatureSelectionTransforms catalog, string labelColumn = "Label", int slotsInOutput = 1000, int numBins = 256, params Microsoft.ML.ColumnOptions[] columns);

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.ML.Transforms.FeatureSelection.MutualInformationFeatureSelectingEstimator SelectFeaturesBasedOnMutualInformation(class Microsoft.ML.TransformsCatalog/FeatureSelectionTransforms catalog, string labelColumn, int32 slotsInOutput, int32 numBins, class Microsoft.ML.ColumnOptions[] columns) cil managed

<Extension()> Public Function SelectFeaturesBasedOnMutualInformation (catalog As TransformsCatalog.FeatureSelectionTransforms, Optional labelColumn As String = "Label", Optional slotsInOutput As Integer = 1000, Optional numBins As Integer = 256, ParamArray columns As ColumnOptions()) As MutualInformationFeatureSelectingEstimator

static member SelectFeaturesBasedOnMutualInformation : Microsoft.ML.TransformsCatalog.FeatureSelectionTransforms * string * int * int * Microsoft.ML.ColumnOptions[] -> Microsoft.ML.Transforms.FeatureSelection.MutualInformationFeatureSelectingEstimator

Docs.param: Name of the column to use for labels.
The maximum number of slots to preserve in the output. The number of slots to preserve is taken across all input columns.
Max number of bins used to approximate mutual information between each input column and the label column. Power of 2 recommended.
Specifies the names of the input columns for the transformation, and their respective output column names.
Docs.summary: Selects the top k slots across all specified columns ordered by their mutual information with the label column.

remarks.para: The mutual information of two random variables X and Y is a measure of the mutual dependence between the variables. Formally, the mutual information can be written as:

where the expectation is taken over the joint distribution of X and Y. Here p(x,y) is the joint probability density function of X and Y, p(x) and p(y) are the marginal probability density functions of X and Y respectively. In general, a higher mutual information between the dependent variable (or label) and an independent variable (or feature) means that the label has higher mutual dependence over that feature. It keeps the top SlotsInOutput features with the largest mutual information with the label.

remarks.para: The mutual information of two random variables X and Y is a measure of the mutual dependence between the variables. Formally, the mutual information can be written as:

where the expectation is taken over the joint distribution of X and Y. Here p(x,y) is the joint probability density function of X and Y, p(x) and p(y) are the marginal probability density functions of X and Y respectively. In general, a higher mutual information between the dependent variable (or label) and an independent variable (or feature) means that the label has higher mutual dependence over that feature. It keeps the top SlotsInOutput features with the largest mutual information with the label.
